titles.title: National Geologic Mapping Reauthorization Act of 1996
To reauthorize and amend the National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.
Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-668.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 342.

action.text: Mr. Calvert moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 597.

action.text: By Senator Murkowski from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report. Report No. 104-395.

bill.summary: 3/29/1996--Introduced. National Geologic Mapping Reauthorization Act of 1996 - Amends the National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 to establish a national cooperative geologic mapping program between the U.S. Geological Survey and State geological surveys. Establishes a geologic mapping advisory committee to advise the Director of the U.S. Geological Survey on planning and implementation of the geological mapping program. Authorizes appropriations.
